file_content.text: Commander Vorel has departed Belsavis. Please proceed about your business.
Commander Vorel sent me. The Rakata technology now belongs to the Empire.
Incredible. I'll file my report at once.
No need, Agent Brandis.
My lord. Masterful performance. Our research station's construction begins as we speak.
Cipher Nine. Flawless execution. Our research station begins construction immediately.
Hunter. Marvelous work. Construction is already underway on our new research station.
Mark this historic moment. The Empire will now break ground on our new research station.
Hurry. My work waits. The Builders' technology calls me.
Patience, doctor. You have proven invaluable, but your insanity is a security risk. We must ensure your silence.
Your work here is done, doctor.
I'll silence him. [Kill Neeya]
You cannot harm me.
The rebirth is coming. I will consume your treacherous Empire!
Sound the alarm!
Cancel the alert, Agent Brandis. Transfer the body to my ship.
The doctor's death was necessary. Well done.
I must leave to oversee the new station. Thanks to you, our second Belsavis will soon master the Rakata's power.
If the Rakata break you, I'll take you down without hesitation.
Don't go crazy out there.
I would expect nothing less.
Without Doctor Neeya's crazed perspective, your research may stall out. The Emperor wouldn't appreciate that.
He's too smart to dispose of.
Perhaps. Come, doctor. Back to work.
The galaxy will see my power.
The rebirth is inevitable. The Builders have shown me the way.
What was that?
Nothing. You never saw this, Agent Brandis. Clear my ship for departure.
Our physicians will stabilize the doctor. The Empire thanks you, for valor and discretion. Soon our second Belsavis will master the Rakata's power.
I expect the station's construction to proceed flawlessly. If delays occur, I will not be pleased.
Keep me updated, Commander.
Understood, my lord.
Get this station operational and deliver results. The Rakata's power has been dormant too long.
I expect a breakthrough soon.
I will double our research personnel, my lord.
Belsavis was too large to remain hidden forever. Don't make the same mistake with our new facility.
Ensure the station's secrecy.
An excellent suggestion. We will update the plans.
I look forward to testing this experimental weaponry myself.
Send me the first prototype.
When our station produces results, you will see them.
Don't let that crazed scientist off his leash anytime soon.
Keep Doctor Neeya in check.
Doctor Neeya will not leave my sight.
I hate to think this is the last time we'll work together.
[Flirt] I hope we meet again.
Continue your service to the Empire, and perhaps we will meet on the battlefield.
I think we're done here.
We are.
Farewell. And long live the Emperor.
I wouldn't keep Commander Vorel waiting.
Cancel spaceport lockdown. I found him.
Cancel spaceport lockdown. I found her.
Cancel spaceport lockdown. I found them.
Beg pardon, my lord. Agent Brandis, at your service. The Imperial Guard requests your immediate attention.
Cipher Nine. A word. Imperial Guard's been looking for you.
You're a difficult mercenary to track down. Please step this way. Imperial Guard wants a word.
Agent Brandis, Intelligence. Please step this way. The Imperial Guard is looking for you.
My lord. A pleasure. Congratulations are due for your dealings with Darth Ekkage.
My lord. Excellent. I feared you had departed Belsavis after your dealings with the Rakata technology.
Agent. I see you survived your business in Megasecurity Ward 23. Impressive.
Hunter. Good. I trust your encounter with Zale Barrows doesn't conclude your business on Belsavis.
At last, the liberators of the Dread Masters.
Finally, we meet. And not a moment too soon.
I am Commander Vorel of the Imperial Guard. Your deeds have drawn the eye of my master, the Emperor. He calls on you for a vital assignment.
Your master hasn't spoken in some time, Commander.
The Emperor? I doubt that.
Of course, my lord. I was speaking metaphorically.
My power increases daily. The Emperor's admiration is only natural.
He is wise to notice me.
I am sure you will meet his high expectations.
The Emperor's plans mustn't be made public to the entire spaceport.
We should talk in private.
Agreed. But until our meeting, we must make do. Agent Brandis, activate your scrambling beacon and begin the briefing.
Even Emperors have to pay for my time.
I take jobs, not assignments.
Your obsession with credits is noted, hunter.
I didn't know the Imperial Guard allowed women into its ranks.
A female Imperial Guard?
The Empire may favor its sons, but I have proven my strength over thousands of men.
Anything for the Emperor.
Patriotism and power. Good.
Agent Brandis--the briefing.
Yes, Commander. As you know, the Rakata built Belsavis's prison. They are gone, but their technology remains buried in the planet.
At oh-seven-hundred hours we located the Rakata machinery that powers Belsavis. Its immediate recovery is the Empire's top priority.
Even the most powerful superweapon can be ground to shrapnel by the dark side.
The Force trumps all machines.
That is precisely why the Rakata fused their technology with the Force.
I'm growing quite familiar with these Rakata devices.
I know of such machinery.
Your unique knowledge factors heavily in your involvement, my lord.
The Rakata technology could revolutionize the Empire's entire arsenal.
We'll learn from their tech.
Exactly why we must claim it before the Republic does.
I usually hunt living targets. Why not send Imperial boys to collect your tech?
Salvage isn't my specialty.
This mission demands the best. And to be honest, the Reclamation Service is not qualified.
What are "Rakata"?
Rakata?
A highly advanced species that ruled the galaxy millennia ago. Records reveal heavy dark side use and unequaled engineering feats.
The Rakata's secrets demand great care. What exactly do you intend to do with this machinery?
Recovery for what purpose?
Alien tech doesn't concern me.
Don't mistake this discovery for some mere alien artifact.
Once secured, the Empire will use the Rakata technology to construct a massive research station in Belsavis's image.
From this second Belsavis, we will harness and perfect the Rakata's might. But first, you must help me claim their technology.
The Rakata's secrets will soon belong to the Empire.
It will be done, Commander.
Take note, Agent Brandis. Before you stands a true Imperial.
If this technology is as powerful as you claim, I can't wait to get my hands on it.
My pleasure, Commander.
You will not be disappointed, my lord.
I'm sold, Commander. This Rakata tech's as good as ours.
Let's do this.
Excellent. We will discuss terms later.
Can you actually duplicate an entire planet?
A second Belsavis?
In spirit, yes. Though our station will make Belsavis pale in comparison.
Join me at site two of the Republic's Domination Experiments. We will discuss your involvement further.
There you have it. Be careful. The Rakata tech has done something awful to the alien prisoners there.
I won't assist. [Refuse quest]
Carry on.
